title: How to Track Your Fleet and Equipment with FieldFix
description: Know where your trucks are, when equipment needs service, and never miss maintenance again.
requirements: Vehicles or equipment you want to track
Basic info about your equipment (make, model, hours/miles)

steps.title: Sign up for FieldFix
steps.description: Create your free account at fieldfix.ai
substeps: Go to fieldfix.ai on your phone or computer
Click 'Get Started' or 'Sign Up'
Enter your email and create a password
Verify your email to activate your account
steps.tip: FieldFix is built specifically for contractors and field service businesses — it's not just a generic tracker.

steps.title: Add your first vehicle or equipment
steps.description: Start with your most important vehicle.
substeps: Click 'Add Equipment' or the + button
Enter: Name (e.g., 'Work Truck 1'), type, make, model, year
Add current mileage or engine hours
Upload a photo if you want (makes it easy to identify)

steps.title: Set up maintenance schedules
steps.description: Tell FieldFix when things need service so it can remind you.
substeps: Click on your equipment, then 'Maintenance Schedule'
Add common items: oil change (every 5k miles), filter replacement, tire rotation
For equipment: teeth replacement, hydraulic service, belt inspection
Set the interval (miles, hours, or time)
steps.tip: Start with the expensive stuff — the maintenance that prevents $5,000 repairs.

steps.title: Enable location tracking (optional)
steps.description: Know where your vehicles are in real-time.
substeps: Install the FieldFix app on phones that stay in vehicles
Enable location permissions when asked
Or purchase a GPS tracker device for always-on tracking
View all vehicles on the map in your dashboard

steps.title: Log your first maintenance
substeps: When you do maintenance, open FieldFix
Tap the equipment, then 'Log Service'
Enter what was done, cost, and current miles/hours
Take a photo of the receipt — it's stored with the record

successMessage: You're now tracking your fleet! You'll get reminders before maintenance is due and have records when it's time to sell.
proTips: Track equipment hours, not just miles — a mulcher with 500 hours needs different care than one with 50
Use FieldFix records when selling equipment — documented maintenance adds resale value
Set reminders a week BEFORE service is due so you can schedule it
